duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide general nursing care to patients and administer prescribed medications and treatments in accordance with nursing standards and per orders.
Organize and provide clinical supervision to the patient care team, including delegation of responsibilities, mentoring, evaluating, educating, scheduling, and counseling the care team staff.
Assist with daily/weekly Care Team scheduling and delegate tasks appropriately according to the scope of licensure.
Prepare and manage materials, deliverables, and review patient charts for missing labs, reports, and/or open orders.
Coordinate outpatient work-up and treatment plans when required, and prepare prescriptions or medication refills for review and signature by provider.

Facilitate clinical messages and chronic condition management education to patients, document progress notes in electronic health record within 24 hours, and manage in-basket requests and respond to all requests in a timely manner.

Serve as a clinical liaison between the call center and medical office, triage urgent same day or double-booked appointment requests, and identify patients who may need point-of-care testing as well as patients with special needs.
Verify chief complaint and take vital signs as requested, review the electronic health record active medication list with patients, and conduct and document point-of-care tests based on protocol.

Contact patients with test results, provide recommendations on cases per physician determination and/or standards of care, and add recommendations to individualized care plans and review After Visit Summary with patient.
Prepare equipment and aid physician during treatment, examination, and testing of patients, and pend tests and procedure orders for physician approval and co-signature.
Assist with new hire orientation, staff training, providing feedback for performance evaluations, and providing information related to employee discipline and termination of staff.
Coordinate and manage daily huddles, review materials and deliverables, and perform other job-related duties as required, including participation in nursing practice work groups and committees.

education_certification.credential: Graduate of an accredited school of nursing
Current unencumbered New York State Registered Nurse license
